metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32208 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When curl < 7.84.0 does FTP transfers secured by krb5, it handles message verification failures wrongly. This flaw makes it possible for a Man-In-The-Middle attack to go unnoticed and even allows it to inject data to the client.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
libcurl3-nss - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
libcurl4 - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3').
